Posts.Content: I am sorry to hear that the breast pain at surgical site may not go away I am half way through 33x radiation. Had 2 surgeries for lumpectomy and node removal ( one node positive), went through chemo (4 AC, 4 Taxol). Am very sore and have alot of pain at breast was hoping it would get better after rad. I am taking arimidex, for chemo has thrown me into menopause. I have not noticed joint pain as of yet, only taken for 3 weeks so far. Will prayer for all. God Bless and be well... Jill

Posts.Title: surgery

Posts.Content: I had microcalcifications surrounding the tumor. They attempted to remove them with the tumor. Microcalcifications alone , I am not for sure how to treat but the drs. should keep a close watch on them. They could be the beginnings of problems. I have been told possibly precancer..but be sure and ask your dr. I could be wrong. Best of luck to you, HUGS. Be well....Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: microcalcifications

Posts.Content: Marybeth, FYI... I too had gotten small pimple like spots on my head previous to hair growth. I am also 2 months post chemo and am receiving radiation right now. I did not notice any from eyebrows or eyelashes but have seen a few under the arms. God Bless and be well. Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: "pimples" with hair growing back

Posts.Content: Sandra, I was dx in march of 2005,finished chemo in august 2005. I have been participating in what sounds like the same clinical trial, triptorelin shot and exemestane, since February 2006. I have just a few side effects. The two most troublesome being numerous hotflashes daily and I have alot of joint pain. Mostly in my hands but at times in feet and hips as well. What has made you decide to have your ovaries removed? Are the shots to hard on you? I wish you well. Nice to talk to someone who is taking the same steps as i am. I have posted before and noone does
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: new to post/BC diagnosed in March of 06

Posts.Content: I have been to see my breast surgeon for a follow-up appointment. She has elected to have an MRI done to the right breast. From my understanding there is something palpable at the tumor site (could be scar tissue or fluid). I had a mammogram in April but , I guess is very dense, so has ordered an MRI. She has mentioned that she would like to have a MRI every year. And also a mammogram every year (each test 6 months apart). My question is has anyone had these tests done on a regular basis like this? And should there be reason for concern?? Also, she says that I am "high risk" , does this mean for recurrence?? Thanks ! God bless and be well..... Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: MRI and mammogram

Posts.Content: Liza, Just wanted to say..my onco dr. ordered bloodwork,FSH, Estadiol,CMP and CCb. I had been taking arimidex for 6 weeks and they told me to stop taking for 30 days before the bloodwork could be done. They said the arimidex would cause false results especially with the estradiol levels which were being checked to see if I truly am in menopause. Best Wishes to you. Be well... Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: Dr. Leo, are FSH and Serum Estradiol worthless if I take AI?

Posts.Content: Hello, I can certainly understand yuor worrying and wondering about life after cancer. I too was diagnosed in 2005 (march) and also had lumpectomy followed by the same chemo and radiation treatments. My oncologists explained to me that all the extra test do not necessarily find anything any faster than no tests. And even if found the treatments would be the same.. They would not catch anything any sooner than if you keep all your regular checkups. It took me some time to allow this to sink in, but I do trust my drs. I hope you can live each day knowing that tommorrow will come. My prayers are with you and your wife during these trying times. God bless and be well ....... Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: Help Regarding Follow Up After Chemotherapy and Radiation.

Posts.Content: Way to go Marion. I am so happy for you. My journey has just began but I know some day I will be able to celenrate as well. Have a great time in Europe. God Bless and be well. Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: I'm Finished! I'm Finished!

Posts.Content: hello all, I am sorry to hear of all the trouble with side effects from the medications that are sopposed to help stop any recurrences. I agree it is difficult to have to take more meds to help relieve the side effects which then cause other side effects. It is a vicious circle. I am taking a medication called Exemestane (participating in a clinical trial- It is concerning whether this med may be better for women compared to taking tamoxifen, seeing if less side effects and easier on premenopausal women.) I have been taking since Feb 2006. I have some joint pain (occasionally need a vicodin to help with pain) and discomfort with vaginal dryness. But nothing real severe, does not stop me from living. I hope everyone will figure out what is right for each individual because we deserve to be able to continue a "normal" living. God bless and be well........Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Well Sue, First I wish you a HAPPY birthday I have talked to my oncologist regarding the surgeon ordering the MRI and she feels very good about the extra testing. So I WILL keep my chin up and see it as a precautionary measure. As for the surgery your husband will be going throughI hope the best for both of you and my prayers are with you. So glad that it was found early. Just wondering will he be placed on the list to receive another kidney?? Hope all goes well, hang in there and try to enjoy your day. God bless and be well........ Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: MRI and mammogram

Posts.Content: Being diagnosed with early stage bc is just as difficult in making all the right decisions for yourself. I was first diagnosed stageI , lumpectomy and then radiation.Sounds pretty simple....But had first surgery, found out after that had positive node and tumor was bigger than originally thought, Then needed second surgery for axillary node disection and more tumor removal. Final path report states stage II bc. Now protocol is to have chemo, 4 AC and 4 Taxol, dose dense, followed by radiation, then tamoxifen. I guess what I'm trying to say is you have to get all the facts and info you can in order to make the right decisions NOW, you can't wait to see if something different comes along. I need to know that if any microcalcifications(cancer cells) are attaching somewhere else in my body that we can do something to stop them from growing. That is why I chose to go with chemo. I have only had 1 treatment so far and I say it was not easy but these bad cells will not be allowed to grow in me!!! So do what is right for YOU and feel good about it. God bless and be well. Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: Treatment for early stage bc

Posts.Content: Hi Danielle, I cannot answer all of yuor concerns. But I will be starting the same chemo protocol on May 11th. Sounds to me that she is getting "dose-dense" treatments, meaning more aggressive. AC every 2 weeks for 4 treatments and then Taxol every 2 weeks for 4 treatments. 16 weeks total treatment time. I would like to hear from you as to your moms progress and how she handles the treatments. I am scared, as I am sure she is too. But everyone here says you can make it through fine. So I am relying on their support. I will be following chemo with radiation therapy and then Tamoxifen for 5 years. I am premenopausal amd drs. talk about stopping the ovaries from producing estrogen during the Tamoxifen use either by meds, surgery to remove, or radiation. Has anyone out there had this done??? God Bless and be well... Jill

Posts.Title: prostesis fitting tomorrow - what's better??

Posts.Content: I just wanted to let you know that this forum is very helpful and the people here are informative because they have been through similar , if not the same situation. I Just finished my last chemo on 8/17/05. I posted here very early in my dx and come back all the time. I don't always write, reading other posts and repliies is comforting. FYI at my last chemo treatment labs showed elevated enzymes in liver as well. Drs. said most likely from treatments and ordered more labs in 3 weeks.The chemo treatments are hard kid you not but VERY doable. Keep positive thoughts and eat healthy and you will be fine. God Bless and be well. Jill

Posts.Title: Scared, new diagnosis, am I alone?

Posts.Content: Well, I guess we can just keep asking in hopes of finding the correct solution..( what ever that may be). I will be starting chemo 5/11/05 every 2 weeks for 8x's then onto radiation for 33x's....so I do have time to think this over and ask more questions before Tamoxifen use. Its good to know that I'm not the only confused person out there. All these different protocols, decisions to be made..I just want, like all of you, to do the best possible option to avoid any reoccurence. That is our biggest fear once get through the treatments. Thanks for all your thoughts. If I get anymore good info on this subject I will let you know. God Bless and be well... Jill

Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: chemo induced menopause??

Posts.Content: looking for some help... I am 40 yrs young, went through AC/taxol dose dense last treatment august 17, 2005.. Finished 6 1/2 weeks of radiation therapy 10 days ago. Started taking tamoxifen, 2 weeks later was switched to arimidex. After chemo had lab work done including Esrodial level (estrogen levels). These levels were so low that I was told I was thrown into menopause by the chemo treatments.( had not had menstrual cycle for 4 months). So, I have been taking arimidex for about 6 weeks now and am having some vaginal discharge. The drs have taken me off the arimidex and want to recheck the Estrodial level in 30 days. In the meantime I have to make an appt to see my Gyn. Has anyone had chemo throw them into menopause and if so did you have any complications with vaginal bleeding. Could possibly be that I am truly not in menopause and my ovaries have woken up thus menstruating again...the other possibilities of what could be happening I am not allowing myself to think about those at this time.
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx

Posts.Title: chemo induced menopause??

Posts.Content: I just recently turned 40, and am premenopausal. The drs. are thinking about suppressing (shutting down) my ovaries so they stop producing estrogen while taking Tamoxifen. My tumor was 2.2 cm and ER+ meaning feeds off estrogen. They can do this by removing ovaries through surgery, or radiation of ovaries , or meds. such as triptorelin given by injection once a month. Has anyone out there come across this type of procedure?? If so what are your thoughts?? Maybe one of the drs. here could give some thought or advice. God Bless and be well... Jill

Posts.Content: Dear BFagan, Thanks for the reply. I went to the dr. and am scheduled for a D&C on tuesday. He says uterus is enlarged and tilted. I will look up the book, for sure, Thanks again and I will keep you posted. HUGS!! Be well...Jill

Posts.Title: chemo induced menopause??

Posts.Content: I have an appointment with GYN on Monday. I am however wondering what to expect at this appointment. I am having a terrible time being patient in finding out what the hell is going on. I feel that I have been down this road already just a few short months ago. I really only had about 9 days (after radiation finished) to celebrate the end of treatments and a very long 8 months of being strong and positive to help myself get through the treatments successfully. I feel now that these celebrations have come to a halt. I am having a hard time staying positive and am beginning to shed a lot of tears because i am scared of the unknown. Is there anyone who has had any of these complications and might know what I may expect?? Feeling very Depressed, Jill

Will need to check with onc on this. (I do have a port if this makes any difference.) God Bless and be well... Jill

Posts.Title: Mom's 1st chemo treatment

Posts.Content: Hello everyone..I have been reading posts for a few days and decided that there are alot of wonderful people with alot of advice here. So i am joining in prayer with all. I noticed indentation and e few days later a lump was felt. Had my first mamm. ever on 3/2/05. Since that day have had three more mamms. Ihave invasive DC, scheduled for lumpectomy on 4/1/05 with SNB and wire localization previous to surgery. Does anyone know if this wire localization procedure is painful?? Ihad a bad experience with core needle biopsy (not being completely numbed up) so I felt the first two extractions. So I'm a little nervous about being poked at again.Any info appreciated and thinking of all. God Bless...

Posts.Title: newbie-lumpectomy 4/01/05

Posts.Content: I just was interested in these post. I am currently waiting to be randomized for a clinical trial which includes ovarian suppression using triptorelin and taking exemestane. the are 2 possibilities are tamoxifen no ovarian suppression and lastly, tamoxifen with ovarian suppression. Are you having side effects from the triptorelin or from the exemestane? Maybe you are unsure. Are you on a clinical trial? God bless and be well, Jill

Posts.Title: ovarian suppression w/triptorelin vs. ovary removal

Posts.Content: hello again..Thanks for the encouraging support. Surgery went as expected. I am recovering well..the usual I suppose..Very tired and some soarness especially at node removal site. The wire localization was not painful but quite uncomfortable for me. I made it through just fine with the help of some sedatives. Next step radiation therapy appt. It is helpful to read the different posts and all of the responses from everyone. Thanks again. God Bless and be well!

Posts.Title: newbie-lumpectomy 4/01/05

Posts.Content: Hello I am going to start taking EXEMESTANE (instead of tamoxifen) and receiving an injection of TRIPTORELIN ,once a month, to stop ovarian function, on Monday. I am doing this as part of a clinical trial for premenopausal women. As I continue research both exemestane and triptorelin I find quite a lot of possible side effects. I am wondering if anyone here has taken either of these medications and how were the side effects for you?? Any replies would be helpful. thanks, God bless and be well...... Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: regarding adjuvant therapy

Posts.Content: I certainly can understand your concern, for me losing my hair was the worst experience especially at the time it started coming out. Yes, you should get a wig just in case, I never used mine but I had it if I felt i needed it. My drs told me that I would definitely lose my hair. I had chemo every 2 weeks and one day after second treatment I had my hair buzzed, sure enough next day started falling out. I want you to know it isn't easy but it will be okay. My hair is starting to grow back now and my kids say It doesnt look like me anymore.( they were so used to seeing me without the hair ) Be well......Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: Will I lose my hair?

Posts.Content: hello again..Thanks for the encouraging support. Surgery went as expected. I am recovering well..the usual I suppose..Very tired and some soarness especially at node removal site. The wire localization was not painful but quite uncomfortable for me. I made it through just fine with the help of some sedatives. Next step radiation therapy appt. It is helpful to read the different posts and all of the responses from everyone. Thanks again. God Bless and be well!
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: newbie-lumpectomy 4/01/05

Posts.Content: Hi all... I ended up in surgery again on 4/8/05. Had positive sentinel node so needed axillary dissection also..had to go into tumor site and remove more tumor. 1 of 6 margins was not clear! At that time had porta-catheter installed for chemotherapy. Was hoping not to have to do chemo treatments but finding positive nodes makes chemo inevitable I guess. I don't know my treatment plan as of yet. Appt with rad. onc. on 4/11 and medical onc. is not until 4/18. I am reading up on all of your posts regarding chemotherapy. I am real scared!! Will keep in touch thanks again for your support ...Hope all is well..Stay positive and God Bless!!

Posts.Content: Dear BFagan, Thanks for the reply. I went to the dr. and am scheduled for a D&C on tuesday. He says uterus is enlarged and tilted. Wants to make certain that nothing is heating up down there. (his words) What ever came of your procedures is this how they found the fibroids??I hope all is okay with you. I will look up the book, for sure, Thanks again and I will keep you posted. HUGS!! Be well...Jill

Posts.Content: Leo, Thank you for reply. I was hoping that this would be regaining of menstrual cycle. My onco said this is rare but has seen it on occasion, last time was 5-6 years ago. I have been on arimidex for a short period of time would this make any difference? Trying to keep my thoughts positive..... God Bless and be well. Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: chemo induced menopause??

Posts.Content: I have an appointment with GYN on Monday. I am however wondering what to expect at this appointment. I am having a terrible time being patient in finding out what the hell is going on. I feel that I have been down this road already just a few short months ago. I really only had about 9 days (after radiation finished) to celebrate the end of treatments and a very long 8 months of being strong and positive to help myself get through the treatments successfully. I feel now that these celebrations have come to a halt. I am having a hard time staying positive and am beginning to shed a lot of tears because i am scared of the unknown. Is there anyone who has had any of these complications and might know what I may expect?? Feeling very Depressed, Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: chemo induced menopause??

Posts.Content: Hello everyone..I have been reading posts for a few days and decided that there are alot of wonderful people with alot of advice here. So i am joining in prayer with all. I noticed indentation and e few days later a lump was felt. Had my first mamm. ever on 3/2/05. Since that day have had three more mamms. Ihave invasive DC, scheduled for lumpectomy on 4/1/05 with SNB and wire localization previous to surgery. Does anyone know if this wire localization procedure is painful?? Ihad a bad experience with core needle biopsy (not being completely numbed up) so I felt the first two extractions. So I'm a little nervous about being poked at again.Any info appreciated and thinking of all. God Bless...

Posts.Title: newbie-lumpectomy 4/01/05

Posts.Content: Dear MomG, I am glad to see that you have found the right forum to seek advise. I am sorry to hear of the complications of your recovery from surgery. I can not say that I have ever heard of the skin dying in this way. Did an infection occur?? I hope you heal quickly after the skin graph and wish you well . I too had right breast cancer dx 3-17-05. I had one positive node so went through chemo and radiation. Will you be receiving any further treatments for the cancer?? God bless and be well... Jill

Posts.Title: I'm new Here!

Posts.Content: cjago My thoughts go out to you it sounds like you have been through alot. Hang in there. So losing ovarian function due to chemo is not so unusual after all. The drs. made it sound like it doesn't happen much at all. I am currently waiting to start a clinical trial which may need to supress ovarian function, depending on how I am randomized. God bless and be well, Jill

Posts.Title: Regarding chemo and menopause (attn:Dr. Leo)

Posts.Content: hi, I was originally taking tamoxifen and no tests were recomended after treatments. There is now talk of switching to arimidex and the only test would be a bone density test. Of course blood tests and checkups every 3 months. God Bless and be well, Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: What tests do you get after all treatment is over?

Posts.Content: For those of you not familiar with my recent posts "chemo induced menopause" I will brief you: I had 2 surgeries for lumpectomy and axillary nodes. Chemotherapy=AC and Taxol. Radiation 33x. During chemo lost menstruation. Tamoxifen for 2 weeks, estrodial level test showed menopausal levels, Switched to Arimidex for 6 weeks. Started having vaginal bleeding, back to med. onc. more blood levels, appt. with Gynecologist, scheduled D&C procedure. Taken off arimidex for 30 days to do yet another estrodial level. I have been back to see my med. onc. The latest two estrodial levels show that I am PREmenopausal. I have been taken off arimidex and put back on Tamoxifen. (I feel like a yo-yo, and I wonder if I will ever feel like my old self again). Dr. Leo, I thought you might want to know this being as you had replied to my post thinking it unlikely that I would regain menstruation. Apparentely, I have gone against the odds again (no breast cancer in my history and age). My med. onc. and my gyn. both agreed with you stating it was very unlikely as well. Med. onc. has seen this occur maybe 3-4 times before, last time being about 4 yrs ago. I am hoping to be able to go one full month without having to see a Dr. God Bless all of you and be well... Jill
Posts.Signature: Dx 3-17-05,breast cancer 40 yrs young, Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, 2.5cm ER+/PR+, Her-2/neu Negative, Grade and Stage 2 1 Sentinel node pos. 17 neg., chemo AC/Taxol , rad.tx
Posts.Title: Regarding chemo and menopause (attn:Dr. Leo)

Posts.Content: This is awful news.. makes you feel like you've lost a friend even though you didn't know her. My prayers are with the her family and everyone at her hospital. Thanks for letting us know. Jill
